hypothesis_content.title: Structural Shift to Spot-Driven Bull Flag
hypothesis_content.statement: If the spot-to-derivatives volume ratio rises above 0.5 (from current ~0.3) while BTC is in a NEUTRAL regime, and price forms a 7-14 day consolidation (max range <8%), the subsequent breakout will have an 80% win rate and average 12% follow-through, indicating a structural shift to healthier, spot-driven price discovery.
hypothesis_content.rationale: October's liquidity crash exposed over-reliance on derivatives. A rising spot ratio indicates stronger hands and real capital allocation. Consolidation after this shift represents accumulation/distribution, leading to higher-probability breakouts.
entry_conditions: Spot volume / Total derivatives volume (aggregate) > 0.5 for 2+ days
BTC price consolidation: 7-14 days, max range <8% from high to low
Price breaks consolidation high/low on increasing spot volume (>20% avg)
hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails despite high spot ratio (suggesting spot selling pressure). Ratio reverts below 0.4.
